column1: The above six grounds are a re-production of the grounds contained in Article 34(2) of the
Model Law, and are the only grounds on which an award may be set aside. Might I add
that had the award before the High Court been a foreign arbitral award, the enforcement
could have been refused as provided by Section 34(1) of the Act, which contains the same
grounds as those set out in Section 32(1).
